Module ajout√©: Cours s√©lectionn√© : Module - D√©finition de l'ISO 27001
L'ISO/IEC 27001 est une norme internationale publi√©e par l'Organisation internationale de normalisation (ISO) et la Commission √©lectrotechnique internationale (IEC). Elle d√©finit les exigences d'un syst√®me de gestion de la s√©curit√© de l'information (SGSI) afin d'assurer la confidentialit√©, l'int√©grit√© et la disponibilit√© des informations d'une organisation.

üéì Un nouveau module a √©t√© ajout√© : Key Aspects of ISO 27001:
ISMS Framework ‚Äì Establishes policies, procedures, and controls to secure information.
Risk Management ‚Äì Identifies, assesses, and mitigates risks to data security.
Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability (CIA) ‚Äì Ensures that information is:
Confidential (only accessible to authorized individuals)
Integral (not altered or corrupted)
Available (accessible when needed)
Annex A Controls (ISO 27002) ‚Äì Includes 93 security controls in areas such as:
Access control
Cryptography
Incident management
Business continuity
Certification ‚Äì Organizations can get certified to demonstrate compliance.
Benefits of ISO 27001 Certification:
‚úîÔ∏è Enhances data security and compliance
‚úîÔ∏è Builds customer trust and brand reputation
‚úîÔ∏è Helps in legal and regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR)
